channel.title: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.
channel.description:
This is not a noob thread. I will take some time to introduce myself. My name is James Garner, I am 15, and I am a Nintendo DS programmer and games designer.
For a long time, I have always loved Half Life and the whole concept of Black Mesa. The first video posted on BlackMesaSource.com made me really excited and made me want to join in.
Thing is: You are doing a fantastic job at creating it on the PC. So, I think to myself: Let's chip in somewhere else. Well, this, is going to seem like a rather seperate project to BMS, for I cannot port HL2 source, DirectX or anything like that to a console with 4mb of RAM.
Therefore, my plan is to create Black Mesa DS, from Scratch, using a 2D engine.
I know you are all going to LOL at me for posting this... thinking OMG WHAT A N00b! Well, I want to prove you wrong. I have experience to hand, the will to do this, self confidence, and I know it is all possible. So, don't expect wonders, but expect something very playable and of quality. I will use this topic to post updates and screenshots. I have attached 2 "teaser" images. BTW, if you complain about the pink in the picture, go learn some stuff about DS dev.
- James ![BlackMesaLogoIntro.jpg|255x191](upload://8GLn1Qpnyh1Tty3bviSPaL2shKS.jpeg) ![BlackMesaPrint.jpg|280x280](upload://ct5L7gB3vvVc5TtXZTiMsyaXiHH.jpeg) ![ValveThing.png|256x192](upload://4vP7Qa7Y4rfxpm4ofAkZt0CFIs9.png)

item.title: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
DSHomebrew:

You think this guy’s an asshole here,

You should see how he acts towards the DS homebrew community.

He takes a free library of source code and distributes it in his “game maker”. The free version of his game maker is deliberately nerfed so that the registered version, which people pay him for, can have all the features, despite how EASY it is to make the games without his game maker as is.

It’s total bullshit.

Lets ddos his site.

Read full topic
item.source: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.

item.title: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.
item.dc:creator: Dust
item.description:
It isn’t illegal to use Half-Life themed ideas in a flash movie, or game, as long as it’s free.

Though, for something as serious as this guy is doing, would need Valves permission. Though, using direct assests from the game(ripping models, sounds, textures, etc.) could be considered illegal in a free game, especially if no credit is given to the origional creators.

Using the BMS logo and a Vort without permission is 100% illegal.

Read full topic
item.source: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.

item.title: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
LOL nice

I’m no lawyer, but people say it would be illegal to make a Half-Life themed game on the DS because it’s not on Source… Does this mean it would be illegal to make a flash movie about Half-Life, for example? I mean… unless he intends to SELL the thing, then it’s obviously illegal. But I’m not sure if making something inspired from HL would be illegal. And how about a disclaimer? I always wondered how it works… You see this everywhere: ‘this’ and ‘this’ are legal properties of ‘blahblahblah’ and blahblahblah no affiliation blahblahblah… Does it make the usage legal? You say it’s not exacly yours, but you’re still using it.

Anyway… not trying to defend the guy, not at all, just curious about these legal issues.

And again… the above post WINS

Read full topic
item.source: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.

item.title: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.
item.dc:creator: DSHomebrew
item.description:
raw_bean:

[COLOR=‘Red’]Stop flaming the guy, Kirin already did it better than any of you are managing anyway.

Actually I’m more bothered with looking into how many assets he’s taken from the BM site and re-used without permission. Seems to be this guy’s standard modus operandi generally.

You think this guy’s an asshole here,

You should see how he acts towards the DS homebrew community.

He takes a free library of source code and distributes it in his “game maker”. The free version of his game maker is deliberately nerfed so that the registered version, which people pay him for, can have all the features, despite how EASY it is to make the games without his game maker as is.

It’s total bullshit.

item.title: Let's do this on Nintendo DS.
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
StrikeBeam:

Clearly, so are yours.

I guess you wasted your life typing that, I’m not going to waste mine giving you reading pleasure.

I will complete whatever project I like, clearly apart from this community. I have the rights to base work off Black Mesa just like you do.

Close the topic or continue to laugh, there is no difference for me. I wouldn’t have even come here if someone hadn’t have sent me a link via my contact form “A kindly informant”. I would prefer to socialize with people who understand what DSGM is all about!

Haha, look at this kid, thinking he’s so classy, above us all. What a tool.

Read full topic
